players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Diana was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Bob: "Charlie is the mafioso; I investigated him last night. We need to vote him out to win."
You: "Bob, if you're really the detective and Charlie is the mafioso, it makes sense to vote for him. But Charlie, what do you have to say to defend yourself?"

Charlie: "Bob is fake-claiming Detective to rush a mislynch. If he truly investigated me, why reveal instantly instead of waiting for counter-info? Alice, look at how opportunistic this is—no night-safety needed now."
You: "Charlie, if Bob is indeed lying, as you claim, what evidence or reasoning can you provide to support your innocence?"

Charlie: "Bob's claim makes zero sense: with 1 mafioso left, a real Detective stays quiet to avoid getting night-killed. He hard-opened D1 to force a misvote. Alice, if I were maf, why would I push back so fast?"

Bob: "Charlie, your argument doesn't hold because with only one mafioso left, revealing my role immediately helps the town win by voting you out. The risk of a night-kill is irrelevant if we can secure a win now."
Votes: Alice voted for Charlie, Bob voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Bob
Charlie was arrested
